exclusion.criterion: Subjects with any of the following past or present mental disorders: psychotic disorders, mood disorders, including bipolar disorders.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Subjects who have displayed significant self-injurious behavior (children who have caused visible harm to themselves).
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Subjects with active seizure disorder (seizures within the past six months).
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Subjects with clinically significant or unstable medical illness, including patients with current evidence of clinically significant hematopoietic, or cardiovascular disease.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Subjects with present or history of the following: gastrointestinal, liver, kidney, or other known conditions which will presently interfere with the absorption, distribution, metabolism, or excretion of drugs.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Subjects who report significant improvement of autism symptoms and behaviors to current medications or have only global autism ratings on the CGI of absent, minimal or mild severity, or who are more than minimally verbal.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Subjects whose global autism ratings are assessed as being absent, minimal or mild.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Treatment within the previous 30 days with any drug known to have a well-defined potential for toxicity to a major organ.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Subjects with clinically significant abnormalities in laboratory tests or physical exam.
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient has hypertension and proteinuria, which may indicate underlying kidney disease. She also reports fatigue and headaches, but no fever or chills. Her physical exam is negative for abdominal pain, change in bowel habits, nausea, vomiting, dysuria, frequency, hematuria or frothy urine.
